result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake R Heimann

defendant.name: Heimann, Blake R
defendant.address: 7102 Jack Pine Rd, Baileys Harbor, WI 54202

records.addlTxt: Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss charges upon plea in 16-CF-25. Court so orders, dismisses case but reads in for sentencing purposes. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. State indicates matter is resolved, requests court set a plea/sentencing date in 30 days. Defendant agrees to removing jury trial from the calendar, requests a plea/sentencing date be set. Court removes JT from the calendar. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 29, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on February 19, 2018 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Defendant indicates he's met with the State in which ADA Grode is requesting some medical records. Defendant is trying to get those records together, requests another status. State asks that jury trial remain on the calendar, requests another status prior to the scheduled trial date. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 12, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Blake R Heimann not in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 1:20 pm, reviews events in file.  Atty Grode indicates he did meet with defendant last week, surprised he's not in court today. Defendant appears at 1:24 pm.  State advises offer was made to defendant, unsure of how defendant wishes to proceed. Defendant would like time to talk to his previous attorney and his family before proceeding. Defendant feels matter will resolve short of trial. State requests leaving JT on the calendar for now. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2018 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recalls case at 1:21 pm. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Court leaves 1/04/18 status on the calendar. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court with attorney Brian Maloney.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file. Atty Maloney indicates the State has made a global offer to resolve all matters, expresses some concern with continued representation of defendant, moves to withdraw from all cases. Court questions defendant on Atty Maloney's request to withdraw.  Defendant has no objection to Atty Maloney withdrawing.  Court grants Atty Maloney's request to withdraw from all cases.  Court questions defendant on how he wishes to proceed. Defendant would like to talk to ADA Grode about resolution of these matters. Further discussion re: legal representation. Court encourages defendant to contact PD to see if he qualifies for their representation. If defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, Court sends waiver of right to atty form and petition for appointment of counsel form with defendant as options for him to fill out before next hearing.  Defendant also has the option of retaining new counsel on his own. Court not removing jury trial from the calendar at this time. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court with attorney Brian Maloney.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maloney indicates there have been talks regarding a global resolution to all matters but matter is not resolved yet. Atty Maloney requests adjournment of trial until the end of August, gives reason for adjournment. State objects to adjournment of trial, makes statement. Atty Maloney responds. Court grants request to adjourn trial. New trial date set. Bond remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 18, 2017 at 09:30 am.

from Atty Maloney dated 11/02/16 indicating defendant is not objecting to State's motion to consolidate. Court advises DA's office to prepare consolidation order.

from Atty Maloney requesting 2-3 week adjournment for more time to review discovery material. Court grants request.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court with attorney Brian Maloney.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maloney requests another status to allow him time to view video discovery from the State. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on August 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.
Defense
Defendant was fingerprinted 5/10/16.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court with attorney Brian Maloney.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on May 10, 2016 at 09:45 am.
